title: Variational Estimation for Multidimensional Item Response Theory Using VEMIRT
text: VEMIRT provides following functions conduct EFA M2PL model: Currently functions estimate standard errors item parameters. following examples use two simulated datasets, E2PL_data_C1 E2PL_data_C2, N=1000 respondents, J=30 items D=3 dimensions, items load different dimensions. E2PL_gvem_rot needs item responses number factors (domain), applies promax rotation (rot = "Promax") default. Another choice rot = "cfQ", performs CF-Quartimax rotation. E2PL_gvem_lasso E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso need item responses, constraint setting (constrain), binary matrix specifying constraints sub-matrix factor loading structure (indic). constrain either "C1" "C2" ensure identifiability. "C1", D\times D sub-matrix indic identity matrix, indicating D items loads solely one factor. Notice first 3 rows E2PL_data_C1$data form identity matrix. "C2", D\times D sub-matrix indic lower triangular matrix whose diagonal elements one, indicating D items loads one factor potentially factors well; non-zero elements diagonal penalized. identification "C2", another argument non_pen provided, specifies anchor item loads factors. following example, first 2 rows row form lower triangular matrix, non_pen can take integer 3 30. E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso needs additional tuning parameter, takes gamma = 2 default. Users referred Cho et al. (2024) algorithmic details. GVEM known produce biased estimates discrimination parameters, E2PL_iw helps reduce bias importance sampling (Ma et al., 2024).

title: Variational Estimation for Multidimensional Item Response Theory Using VEMIRT
text: VEMIRT provides following functions conduct EFA M3PL model: following examples use two simulated datasets, E3PL_data_C1 E3PL_data_C2, N=1000 respondents, J=30 items D=3 dimensions, items load different dimensions. usage functions similar M2PL models, additional arguments required: size subsample iteration (samp = 50 default), forget rate stochastic algorithm (forgetrate = 0.51 default), mean variance normal distribution prior item difficulty parameters (mu_b sigma2_b), \alpha \beta parameters beta distribution prior guessing parameters (Alpha Beta). Still, E3PL_sgvem_adaptlasso needs tuning parameter, takes gamma = 2 default. Users referred Cho et al. (2024) algorithmic details. following examples, priors difficulty parameters guessing parameters N(0,2^2) \beta(10,40) respectively.

title: Variational Estimation for Multidimensional Item Response Theory Using VEMIRT
text: VEMIRT provides following functions conduct CFA M2PL model: binary loading indicator matrix needs provided CFA. C2PL_gvem can produce biased estimates two functions help reduce bias. Also, C2PL_gvem, C2PL_bs C2PL_iw2 able provide standard errors item parameters. C2PL_iw C2PL_iw2 apply almost algorithm different implementations. specifically, C2PL_iw2 calls D2PL_gvem estimation, unlike C2PL_iw uses stochastic gradient descent resampling posteriors latent traits iteration, C2PL_iw2 samples posteriors tends less stable accurate. Users referred Cho et al. (2021) C2PL_gvem Ma et al. (2024) C2PL_iw C2PL_iw2. following examples use simulated dataset, C2PL_data, N=1000 respondents, J=20 items D=2 dimensions.

title: Variational Estimation for Multidimensional Item Response Theory Using VEMIRT
text: VEMIRT provides following functions detect DIF M2PL model: Currently D2PL_pair_em supports unidimensional latent trait , strongly recommended D=1 produces accurate estimates allows comparison every pair groups. D2PL_pair_em requires item responses group membership input. require loading indicator assumes every item loads single dimension. following example, responses generated two-dimensional latent traits correlation 0.8, treat one dimension. Note truncated lasso (L_1) penalty becomes lasso penalty tau takes Inf. following example, DIF detection results ordered pairs groups DIF parameters flagged X. D2PL_pair_em fit need, recommend D2PL_em low-dimensional cases (e.g., D\leq 3) accurate; D2PL_gvem recommend high-dimensional cases /fast estimation. functions require item responses, loading indicator, group membership. Besides, estimation method (method) tuning parameter vector (Lambda0) two important arguments. EMM IWGVEMM default choices recommended D2PL_em D2PL_gvem respectively methods accurate. Specifically, IWGVEMM additional importance sampling step GVEM estimation. recommend D2PL_lrt time-consuming. Users referred Wang et al. (2023) D2PL_em Lyu et al. (2025) D2PL_gvem. example , results ordered groups group 1 reference group. DIF parameters flagged X, indicating item parameter group different group 1. default, D2PL_em D2PL_pair_em choose best tuning parameters using Bayesian information criterion (BIC), D2PL_gvem uses generalized information criterion (GIC) c=1. example 0.5 chosen, AIC, BIC, GIC values c can also used specifying "AIC", "BIC", value c functions coef, print summary. suggest c 0 1, larger values lead lower true false positive rates. message warns us optimal tuning parameter AIC may range specified estimation. title: Variational Estimation for Multidimensional Item Response Theory Using VEMIRT
text: show two examples test VEMIRT package simulating data, estimating model using VEMIRT, checking accuracy.

title: Variational Estimation for Multidimensional Item Response Theory Using VEMIRT
code: set.seed(1) Sigma <- matrix(c(1, 0.85, 0.85, 1), 2) J <- 10 N <- 1000 model <- cbind(rep(1:0, J / 2), rep(0:1, J / 2)) a <- matrix(runif(J * 2, 1, 3), ncol = 2) * model b <- rnorm(J) theta <- rmvnorm(N, rep(0, 2), Sigma) data <- t(matrix(rbinom(N * J, 1, plogis(a %*% t(theta) - b)), nrow = J))  result.gvem <- C2PL_gvem(data, model) result.iw <- C2PL_iw(data, result.gvem) result.iw2 <- C2PL_iw2(data, model)  rmse <- function(x, y) {   sqrt(mean((x - y) ^ 2)) } c(a = rmse(a[model == 1], coef(result.gvem)[, 1:2][model == 1]), b = rmse(b, coef(result.gvem)$b)) #>         a         b  #> 0.6039514 0.1318309 c(a = rmse(a[model == 1], coef(result.iw)[, 1:2][model == 1]), b = rmse(b, coef(result.iw)$b)) #>          a          b  #> 0.40411993 0.09705373 c(a = rmse(a[model == 1], coef(result.iw2)$a[model == 1]), b = rmse(b, coef(result.iw2)$b)) #>         a         b  #> 0.1370900 0.0771889

title: Variational Estimation for Multidimensional Item Response Theory Using VEMIRT
code: set.seed(1) Sigma <- matrix(c(1, 0.85, 0.85, 1), 2) J <- 10 j <- J * 0.4 n <- 300 group <- rep(1:3, each = n) model <- cbind(rep(1:0, J / 2), rep(0:1, J / 2)) a <- matrix(runif(J * 2, 1, 3), ncol = 2) * model a <- unname(abind(a, a, a, along = 0)) a[-1, 1:(j / 2), ] <- a[-1, 1:(j / 2), ] + c(0.5, 1) a[-1, (j / 2 + 1):j, ] <- a[-1, (j / 2 + 1):j, ] - c(0.5, 1) a[-1, , ] <- a[-1, , ] * abind(model, model, along = 0) b <- rnorm(J) b <- unname(rbind(b, b, b)) b[-1, 1:(j / 2)] <- b[-1, 1:(j / 2)] - c(0.5, 1) b[-1, (j / 2 + 1):j] <- b[-1, (j / 2 + 1):j] + c(0.5, 1) theta <- rmvnorm(n * 3, rep(0, 2), Sigma) data <- t(sapply(1:(n * 3), function(n) {   rbinom(J, 1, plogis(a[group[n], , ] %*% theta[n, ] - b[group[n], ])) }))  result.iw <- D2PL_gvem(data, model, group, verbose = F) result.iw.gic_0.3 <- summary(result.iw, 0.3) result.iw.gic_1 <- summary(result.iw, 1) result.iw.bic <- summary(result.iw, 'BIC')  count <- function(j, result) {   pos <- colSums(result) > 0   c(`True Positive` = mean(pos[1:j]), `False Positive` = mean(pos[-(1:j)])) } count(j, coef(result.iw.gic_0.3)) #>  True Positive False Positive  #>            1.0            0.5 count(j, coef(result.iw.gic_1)) #>  True Positive False Positive  #>           0.75           0.00 count(j, coef(result.iw.bic)) #>  True Positive False Positive  #>      1.0000000      0.1666667

text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA indic \(J \times K\) matrix data.frame describes factor loading structure \(J\) items \(K\) factors. consists binary values 0 refers item irrelevant factor, 1 otherwise. exploratory factor analysis adaptive lasso penalty, indic include constraints \(K \times K\) sub-matrix ensure identifiability. remaining parts assume pre-specified zero structure instead, appropriate lasso penalty recover true zero structure. Also see constrain max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 5000 constrain constraint setting: "C1" "C2". ensure identifiability, "C1" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix indic identity matrix.constraint anchor \(K\) factors designating \(K\) items load solely factor respectively. Note \(K \times K\) matrix appear top indic matrix. "C2" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix lower triangular matrix diagonal ones. , test items associated factor sure may associated factors well. Nonzero entries (lower triangular part) except diagonal entries sub-matrix penalized estimation procedure. instance, assume \(K=3\), "C2" constraint imply following submatrix: \(C2=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 1\\\end{bmatrix}\). shown, item 1 allowed load first factor, item 2 sure load second factor may also load first factor (hence penalty added \((2,1)\) element "C2", .e., \(C2_{2,1}\) ). Item 3 sure load third factor may also load first two factors. However, note remaining items loading vector \((1, 1, 1)\) hence indistinguishable third anchor item. Therefore, need alert algorithm third anchor item sure load third factor, whether loads first two factors depends regularization results. Therefore, need specify "non_pen=" identify \(K\)th anchor item. Although, "C2" much weaker "C1", still ensures empirical identifiability. Default "C1". estimation, "C1" "C2" constraints, population means variances constrained 0 1, respectively. non_pen index item associated every factor constraint "C2". C1, input can NULL gamma numerical value adaptive lasso parameter. Zou (2006) recommended three values, 0.5, 1, 2. default value 2.

title: VEMIRT: A Package for High-Dimensional IRT Models — VEMIRT-package
text: E2PL_gvem_rot conducts M2PL Analysis post-hoc rotation (Promax & CF-Quartimax) E2PL_gvem_lasso conducts M2PL Analysis Lasso penalty E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso conducts M2PL Analysis adaptive Lasso penalty E2PL_iw conducts importance sampling correct bias M2PL analysis E3PL_sgvem_rot conducts stochastic GVEM improve computational effficiency exploratory M3PL analysis E3PL_sgvem_lasso conducts M3PL Analysis Lasso penalty E3PL_sgvem_adaptlasso conducts M3PL Analysis adaptive Lasso penalty MGRM_gvem conducts GVEM multidimensional graded response model post-hoc rotation MGPCM_gvem conducts GVEM multidimensional partial credit model post-hoc rotation

title: VEMIRT: A Package for High-Dimensional IRT Models — VEMIRT-package
text: C2PL_gvem conducts GVEM confirmatory M2PL analysis C2PL_bs conducts bootstrap sampling correct bias produce standard errors confirmatory M2PL analysis C2PL_iw conducts importance sampling correct bias M2PL analysis C2PL_iw2 conducts IW-GVEM confirmatory M2PL analysis (alternative implementation C2PL_iw) C3PL_sgvem conducts stochastic GVEM confirmatory M3PL analysis MGRM_gvem conducts GVEM multidimensional graded response model MGPCM_gvem conducts GVEM multidimensional partial credit model

title: VEMIRT: A Package for High-Dimensional IRT Models — VEMIRT-package
text: D1PL_em conducts DIF analysis M1PL models using EM algorithms D1PL_gvem conducts DIF analysis M1PL models using GVEM algorithms D2PL_em conducts DIF analysis M2PL models using EM algorithms D2PL_pair_em conducts DIF analysis 2PL models using EM algorithms group pairwise truncated \(L_1\) penalty D2PL_gvem conducts DIF analysis M2PL models using GVEM algorithms D2PL_lrt conducts DIF analysis M2PL models using likelihood ratio test
